concept.title: Deploying Configuration Files without the Cluster Configuration Service
concept.shortdesc: You can deploy your configuration files in your system directory structure or in jar files. You determine how you want to deploy your configuration files and set them up accordingly.

note.p: If you use the cluster configuration service to create and manage your cluster configuration, the procedures described in this section are not needed because automatically manages the distribution of the configuration files and jar files to members of the cluster. See .
You can use the procedures described in this section to distribute configurations that are member-specific, or for situations where you do not want to use the cluster configuration service.
